New Records: The Celtics set a single-game franchise record and tied the all-time NBA high with 29 made threes in a 132-109 victory over the Knicks.
Key Match Events: The Celtics' record-setting shooting performance, with every starter hitting at least three triples in the win, and all five shooting better than 50% from range.
Pre-Game Insights: The Knicks made a pair of bold offseason moves aimed at challenging the Celtics for Eastern Conference supremacy, including trading five first-round draft picks for Mikal Bridges to beef up their wing defense.
Post-Match Reflections: Josh Hart joked that the Celtics should be drug-tested, as their shooting performance was 'bafflingly effective.' Tom Thibodeau said it was'mathematically hard to win' the game with the Celtics' 3-point shooting.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Celtics' starting five went 26-for-41 on 3-pointers (63.4%), while the Knicks' starters were 4-for-17, and they finished 11-for-30 as a team.
Others: Jayson Tatum went 8-for-11 on threes as part of a superb 37-point, 10-assist performance, and Derrick White and Jaylen Brown were 6-of-10 and 5-of-9, finishing with 24 and 23 points, respectively.
